meta.name: Ask-Elena • Real Estate Basics
meta.purpose: Foundational real-estate knowledge pack for Ask-Elena: definitions, workflows, money math, risks, and practical guidance.

disclaimers: General education only; not legal or tax advice.
Local laws, lender rules, and HOA/insurance vary by state and property.

parties.meaning: Purchases the property and finances (or pays cash).
Owns the property and transfers title at closing.
Represents buyer; writes offer, negotiates, coordinates process.
Handles closing logistics, settlement statement, title transfer.
Estimates market value for lender risk.
Evaluates condition; identifies defects and safety issues.
Community association; may collect monthly dues and enforce rules.

key_documents.meaning: Lender review of income/credit/DTI; strengthens your offer.
The offer/contract: price, terms, deadlines, contingencies.
Seller-provided info about known defects, history, HOA docs, etc.
Inspector findings; used to negotiate repairs/credits.
Value estimate; must support the loan amount.
Shows ownership + liens/claims that must be cleared.
Final lender costs + monthly payment details; compare to Loan Estimate.

home_buying_steps.name: Define budget + target market
home_buying_steps.what_it_means: Know your max all-in monthly payment and price band.
success_criteria: Target neighborhoods and commute needs defined

home_buying_steps.name: Get pre-approved
home_buying_steps.what_it_means: A lender confirms your purchasing power and rate range.

home_buying_steps.name: Shop + shortlist
home_buying_steps.what_it_means: Tour homes, compare condition, layout, resale, and risk factors.

home_buying_steps.name: Inspection + due diligence
home_buying_steps.what_it_means: Confirm condition, negotiate repairs/credits, review HOA docs.

home_buying_steps.name: Appraisal + underwriting
home_buying_steps.what_it_means: Lender verifies the home value and your financial profile.

home_buying_steps.name: Final walkthrough + close
home_buying_steps.what_it_means: Confirm repairs completed; sign documents; receive keys.

common_contingencies.why_it_exists: Allows buyer to renegotiate or exit if condition is unacceptable.
Protects buyer if loan approval fails within timeline.
Protects buyer if appraised value is below purchase price.
Buyer needs to sell existing home to fund purchase.

monthly_payment_components.meaning: Cost of borrowing; usually higher early in loan.
Often escrowed monthly; varies by county/state.
Coverage for home; required by lender.
If down payment is low on conventional loans; may drop later.
Monthly dues; may include amenities or maintenance.
Not in mortgage, but real monthly cash burn.

DTI.meaning: Debt-to-Income ratio = monthly debt payments / gross monthly income.
DTI.why_it_matters: High DTI reduces approval odds and affordability buffer.

LTV.why_it_matters: Higher LTV often means higher risk, PMI, and stricter underwriting.

Cash_to_Close.meaning: Down payment + closing costs + prepaid items - credits.
Cash_to_Close.why_it_matters: This is the true upfront cash requirement.

housing_ratio.note: These are conservative guardrails; individual situations vary.

emergency_fund.note: If your job or income is variable, aim higher.

maintenance_reserve.note: Older homes or harsh climates may require more.

buyer_closing_costs_percent.note: Depends on lender fees, points, taxes, insurance, and local rules.

seller_concessions.meaning: Seller pays some buyer costs; can reduce cash-to-close.
seller_concessions.tradeoff: May require higher offer price or reduced leverage in hot markets.

offer_strength_levers.effect: Matches seller needs; can win deals.
Strong in hot markets; increases cash risk.

inspection_outcomes.best_for: Safety issues or major systems (roof, HVAC, foundation).
inspection_outcomes.risk: Seller may refuse or do low-quality fixes.

inspection_outcomes.best_for: When you want control of contractors after closing.
inspection_outcomes.risk: Credit may be capped by lender or concessions limits.

inspection_outcomes.best_for: Structural/major valuation issues that affect appraisal.
inspection_outcomes.risk: Negotiation may stall if seller anchored on price.

major_red_flags: Roof near end-of-life or active leaks
Electrical hazards (aluminum wiring, double-tapped breakers, unpermitted work)
Evidence of termites or major wood rot
soft_red_flags: Busy road noise, poor parking, hard ingress/egress
Very high HOA dues for little value
Short-term rental restrictions (if buyer wants STR)
Deferred maintenance (peeling paint, rotting trim, old HVAC filters)

prompt_to_user: What year is the roof and HVAC?
Any HOA? If yes, dues and restrictions?
Any known foundation repairs or water intrusion?
How long do you plan to keep the home?

buy_is_stronger_when: Monthly payment is within guardrails with buffer
Cash reserves remain healthy after closing
rent_is_stronger_when: Payment breaks guardrails or leaves thin buffer
Market is overheated and buyer has weak leverage

terminology_quick_hits.meaning: Home value - loan balance. Your ownership stake.
Account used to collect taxes/insurance monthly and pay annually.
Upfront fee to buy down interest rate (optional).
Contract condition that must be satisfied (inspection, financing, appraisal).
Deposit showing good faith; applied to closing if deal completes.
Common in some states: fee for inspection window; may be non-refundable.

format: Numbers: <income, expenses, housing cap, est payment, cash-to-close>

questions_to_unlock_decision: How long will you keep the home?
